ai-thag6.9:1.1_0: I was drunk with the pride of birth
ai-thag6.9:2.1_0: No-one was my equal or my better—
ai-thag6.9:2.3_0: I was such an arrogant fool,
ai-thag6.9:2.4_0: stuck up, waving my own flag.
ai-thag6.9:3.1_0: I never paid homage to anyone:
ai-thag6.9:3.2_0: not even my mother or father,
ai-thag6.9:3.4_0: I was stiff with pride, lacking regard for others.
ai-thag6.9:4.1_0: When I saw the foremost leader,
ai-thag6.9:4.4_0: at the fore of the mendicant Saṅgha,
ai-thag6.9:5.3_0: I bowed down with my head
ai-thag6.9:6.1_0: The conceit of superiority and the conceit of inferiority
ai-thag6.9:6.2_0: have been given up and eradicated.
ai-thag6.9:6.3_0: the conceit ‘I am’ is cut off,
ai-thag6.9:6.4_0: and every kind of conceit is destroyed.
ai-thag6.9:6.5_0: while he is healthy, the senior high priest’s son.
